com.esri.mo2.client.aims
Class ArcIms4Connection

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.client.aims.ArcIms4Connection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Connection
public class ArcIms4Connection
extends Object
implements Connection

This connection provides access to the Content found at an ArcIMS 4 web site.

Constructor Summary
ArcIms4Connection()
          null constructor required for obtaining content via an access string.
ArcIms4Connection(String url)
          construct an ArcIMS 4 connection for given server url, default (null) username and password are assumed

          construct an ArcIMS 4 connection for given server url, username and password

Constructor Detail

ArcIms4Connection

public ArcIms4Connection()
null constructor required for obtaining content via an access string. If this constructor is used, nothing will be defined for the connection object until setConnection is called

See Also:
ContentUtility

ArcIms4Connection

public ArcIms4Connection(String url)
                  throws IOException
construct an ArcIMS 4 connection for given server url, default (null) username and password are assumed

Parameters:
url - the URL of the ArcIMS 4 web site
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if url is null
IOException - if the url is not properly formed
See Also:
ArcIms4Connection(String,String,String)

ArcIms4Connection

public ArcIms4Connection(String url,
                         String username,
                         String password)
                  throws IOException
construct an ArcIMS 4 connection for given server url, username and password

Parameters:
url - the URL of the ArcIMS 4 web site
username - the optional login name
password - the password (only required if login specified)
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if url is null, or username is not null but password is null
IOException - if the url is not properly formed
See Also:
ArcIms4Connection(String)

equals

public boolean equals(Object object)
Description copied from interface: Connection
this equals() functions the same way as Object.equals() but must not test for object equality (x == y). Implementations should test that the given object has the same implementation class as this Connection, then check that the Connection parameters are identical - or equivalently, the values returned from toString() are equal.

Specified by:
equals in interface Connection
Overrides:
equals in class Object
Parameters:
object - the other object to be compared for equality
Returns:
true if considered equal, false otherwise
See Also:
Object.equals(java.lang.Object), Connection.toString()

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Description copied from interface: Connection
a Connection must implement hashCode() to match the results of equals(), in order for SourceCache and CatalogModel to locate Connection objects within a HashMap

Specified by:
hashCode in interface Connection
Overrides:
hashCode in class Object

toString

public String toString()
The connection string has the following form. url{!username!password} {username} and {password} will only be present if specified

Specified by:
toString in interface Connection
Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
the connection string
See Also:
Connection.equals(java.lang.Object)

toStringWithoutPassword

public String toStringWithoutPassword()
Similar to toString(). This method returns a String that is suitable for display in a user interface url{!username}

Returns:
the connection string without password
